body: I have persistent mild depression which is intensified by SAD in the late fall and winter months. I started taking this supplement once before bedtime about 4 months ago, in addition to 1000 mg of St. John's wort spread out over the day, and 2000 mg of Fish Oil. It has improved the quality of my sleep (less waking up, less racing thoughts, easier to get back to sleep after waking), and seems to provide just the right amount of mood lift in conjunction with the St. John's Wort to get me through the day without undue irritability.  Taking it at night, I haven't noticed any side effects. On occasions when I've taken it in the morning with the St.  John's Wort, I've had mild symptoms of Serotonin Syndrome (some rapid heartbeat, mild headache, some nausea). So, I won't repeat that experiment again. In the past, I have used both Paxil and Lexapro for depression, with various issues, including frequent migraines (the Paxil) and random daytime sleepiness (Lexapro).  I find the current combination I'm taking, along with regular light box use in the darker months, keeps me on a pretty even keel. I have not tried other manufacturers' versions of 5-HTP, but Naturewise's product seems to be of good quality and potency.
title: Helpful supplement for mild depression, SAD and sleep issues

body: I purchased a bottle of NatureWise 5-htp after trying other brands and finding them somewhat lacking.  Having been hit with a severe case of clinical depression that has lasted over a year now, I have tried all the over the counter antidepressants available, having done my research and deciding against taking prescription SSRI's due to all the terrible side effects and the fact that modern medicine is still unclear as to how they work, or if they really work at all.  St. John's wort was useless and SAM-e made me anxious and made my head feel strange and uncomfortable.  5-htp seems to work better than either of these and also helps with the insomnia that accompanies my depression.  It has been hell, literally, and I am thankful for any slight relief, and 5-htp seems to be helping.  I also like that NatureWise is the only brand I've come across that labels itself as non-GMO as this is really important to me.  Very satisfied with the results I've seen in the two weeks that I've been taking NatureWise 5-htp.  The very fact that I could write this speaks wonders.  My depression was so terrible that I couldn't even put words together.  And they sent me a free bottle as well for sharing my experience.  Awesome.  Thank you.

body: I have come up with the trifecta of Naturewise products for myself, which consists of the 5-HTP, the CLA and the Thermo Blend.  In the past 6 months, I noticed a marked decline in my energy and even in my mood, coupled with extra cushioning around my middle for no apparent reason (considering my unimpeachable diet and fitness lifestyle).  I don't have a huge margin of error to work with, as I am petite (so, we are talking about the difference between fitting into my size 4 jeans an my size 2 jeans.  Sorry if I sound like a brat, but I'm a 44-year old "retired" athlete and am not very forgiving of myself and of the aging process).  I can now honestly say that my extra pudge is gone, my energy is improved, and my mood is stable (probably has something to do with the pudge going away, too).  Are these products the reason?  Who knows for certain, as there are so many other factors that could contribute to biological fluctuations.  But the bottom line is that they aren't doing any harm, so I will continue with them.  Also, I want to give a shout out to the truly outstanding customer service I have experienced with Naturewise.
title: Improved energy and mood, decreased pudge (combined with other Naturewise products)

body: I'm on my second bottle of 5-HTP. The first bottle was the 100mg dose and it worked pretty well, but I thought I'd try the higher 200mg dose. I am so glad I did. It's very affordable and it makes a very positive difference for me. I have been a yo yo dieting, chronically depressed insomniac for 40 years. I started this higher dose on 1/20/17. I'm writing this on 2/3/17. Since January 20 I haven't had even one sleepless night. I've been trying to lose 35 pounds since last March (2016). Every ounce lost is like pulling teeth. Since 1/20/17 when I started the 200mg dose, I've lost 7 pounds - half a pound each day for 14 days!  As of this morning, I'm 2/5 of a pound from my goal. I haven't been able to lose weight this easily since my twenties. The past 3 days I have had a few things happen personally that would normally have set me back to the lowest depression level. I'm guessing it's the 5-HTP that is keeping me feeling calm and, I have to say- almost happy.I can get through the day without crying or catastrophizing and being completely depressed and undone every time something goes wrong. I know everyone's different, but for me it works great!
title: Natrol 5-HTP Time Release 200mg tablets had a very good effect on me.

body: As someone who has struggled with major mood swing, PMS and OCD most of my adult life I gave in several years ago and started taking Effexor  because I was getting on my own nerves. Although it did help me 100% the side effects were horrible if I missed a dose. I decided I didn't want to feel dependent on a medicine like that anymore and  it took me 6 months to wean off of it. Brain zaps. nausea, shaking, you name it and I experienced it from the withdrawals. I recently started feeling like I needed something again and decided to purchase 5-HTP based off of research and product reviews. I initially took half a dose about 30 mins before bed because I wasn't really sure what the side effects would be since it was new to my system. I can say that it really does help to settle my crazy restless mind at just 100mg and for the first time in months I was able to sleep so so. Not awesome but better than usual. After three days I started taking the 200mg dosage at bedtime. I honestly feel normal I guess you can say. My sleep isn't soundly and all night but I am sleeping better. I know how the Effexor made me feel and this is similar. I am not near as moody or obsessive about the order of things. I honestly just think I am one of these people who have some wacky chemically imbalanced brain and I need to forever take something to just feel human. If I forget to take one I don't feel ill like I did with Effexor so I feel confident that I could just cold turkey stop them if I ever wanted to and not have horrible withdrawals. Everyone is different but for me I will continue to take these because they really seem to help stabilize me.
title: Previous Effexor User

body: Creates as many side effects as a prescription SSRI. After being on Paxil for more than 10 years, I (with the help of my Dr.) decided to ween off. For fear of relapsing (severe anxiety with mild depression), and after some research, I decided to try 5HTP. For the first weak, I felt odd, not bad, just a bit off. During week 2, I was feeling good and thought I found a new miracle supplement. Week 3, I started to feel lightheaded, jittery, trouble focusing, numbness in various parts of my body, tired and had orange urine (usual clear, I drink plenty of water). Symptoms continued into week 4. After much more research and talks with my Dr. , I found out 5HTP effects cortisol levels. It was causing my blood sugar to be out of control. I stopped taking it, and now take a saffron supplement, and feel so much better. I know I'm not a Dr. and 5HtP with effect each person differently, but I would not recommend this to anyone. Healthy diet, daily cardio workout, and TaiChi was what initially gave me the strength to get of Paxil. I recommend that.

body: Keep in mind, the ingredients included in this bottle have not undergone any scrutiny or double-blind placebo  randomize trials (as with any "all natural" medication out there).  There is simply no objective testing. Nonetheless, I bought this thinking that it may curb my appetite to help me lose a couple of pounds. I found this made me experience an uneasy feeling in my head (don't know how to describe it) and it interfered with the effectiveness of my acid reflux medication when taken together. I don't understand where all these five star reviews are coming from?  I do know that the placebo affect is very strong and has to be actively worked against in any drug trial.  That may account for some. Who knows, maybe physiological differences  between individuals result with a desired effect.  Either way, I'd recommend staying away from this product.
title: Placebo effect is strong with the 5 star reviewers

body: I am a 29 year old male.  I have been using this in conjunction with St.Johns Wort and B Stress Complex Tabs for 2 weeks so far.  I have noticed a decrease in my social anxiety.  Before I would get very nervous in social situations, going so far as avoiding them altogether or getting there and freezing up.  This does not happen any more, I even go to the gym and feel completely comfortable, where as before I was terrified of going to the gym.  I will say I have been having very very vivid dreams, nothing considered a nightmare but I am always able to wake up and remember them.  I even had one dream where I dreamed I was taking 5-HTP and I knew it caused vivid dreams.  Anyways I will post a follow up rating in another few weeks, but I definitely plan on re-ordering and would recommend this product to others.

body: While trying to come off Cymbalta (horrible drug!!) and dealing with painful withdrawal, I read 5-htp helps. I started taking 200mg and it helped some with the brain shocks of Cymbalta withdrawal. I increased my dose to 400mg 1x daily and saw more improvement in withdrawal symptoms. I have been off Cymbalta for over a year now. I have been taking 400mg - 800mg of 5-htp every morning. I have no issues with this supplement and I am doing much better with anxiety, depression, tension headaches, fibromyalgia, and generally feel more relaxed and calm. I only wish this brand offered higher doses or higher pill count so I need less bottles. Overall very happy with the product

body: I was looking for something natural as I have suffered from Major Depression my whole life and even prescription meds have not helped me. I got this back in November 2013 and only took for a week and my life was sent into a tailspin (Just getting around to reviewing!) I always had normal, albeit, a little heavy periods (sorry if tmi, but want to help others if I can). But a week after taking this, I started bleeding CRAZY heavy out of the blue - like 2 weeks of hemorrhaging, then 10 days off, then 2 more weeks and so on and so forth until I needed to have 2 blood transfusions (one in January and one in February)! I do not believe this is a coincidence as this has never happened to me before. I think this 5-htp threw my hormones into a crazy tailspin of which I am still dealing with. Just be careful; just because something is 'natural' does not mean it is always safe! BTW, did nothing for my mood.

body: Have been taking this for over one month , I'm noticing a definite improvement in my mood , it seems the negative thoughts don't take root in my head any more like they used to - before taking the 5 htp some ugly thought , or some silly comment made from someone would set up in my head and would not leave . I knew this was not how I wanted to be but could not stop feeling this way, I knew living like this was affecting my life and the ones I loved . I have been on antidepressants before and have stopped because of some side effect that would manifest sooner or later .  I hated the idea of being on them - never had any real relief anyways . I also would look up self help articles on the web , books , anything I thought would help with this problem I've been living with for most of my life . Then I came across information on the internet about 5 htp , decided to give it a shot - it's one of the best things I've ever done for myself , and I hope others suffering in the same way find the same relief I have had with this product . The best advice I can give is get on the internet and do your own research on symptoms of low serotonin levels . Read other people's experience using 5 htp , start with the lowest dosage and go from there . I figured out that for me it was best to take it late in the evening , right after supper or even a couple hours after supper was o.k. Mornings was not a good time because I felt it kind of made me feel edgy . The good results really started kicking in about three weeks taking this product , I am amazed at the peace of mind I have now , it's so good to go about my day and not have some horrible negative thought take over my mind completely. I also feel this has had other beneficial benefits to my general well being and health but I want wait a little longer to see if the improvement is consistent in those areas. body: I wanted to try 5-HTP to help stabilize my mood a little better. Since I suffer from PMDD and anxiety attacks, I figured this stuff would be perfect for me. Plus I read a lot of great reviews about it, so I figured things should go great.  I took my first pill at night and the next morning I did feel a slight difference; I had a little pep in my step and figured this stuff is working for me. I had a good day, I was productive at work and at the gym, things are looking good!  I took another pill the following evening and had a completely different experience. The next morning, I woke up more tired than usual.  I was on edge the whole day, one minute I was pissed at the world, the next minute I was on the verge of tears; I felt sleepy and physically exhausted. I got extremely winded just walking up 2 flights of stairs, my heart was pounding out of my chest, totally not normal. I did not feel good what so ever!  At first I wasn't too sure why I felt sooo awful, since just about every one raved how great this stuff is. I thought perhaps it was because I worked out too hard the day before or I was on one of my moody PMDD trips but this felt different. All these physical and mental abnormalities was definitely concerning.  So, after feeling like total crap the whole day and not my normal self, I concluded it's the 5-HTP.  Perhaps the 200 mg dosage is too high for me and or this stuff just doesn't agree with my body. I want to experiment and cut my dosage in half to see if I might have better results but next time I will try it over the weekend/at home instead of during the week while I'm at work. Yet, I don't know if it would even be worth trying again, since it made me feel so bad the first time around.

body: I'm big on vitamins- really any natural way to nurture your body without drugs is my priority. I've heard great things about 5-HTP, and I even read in an article by Dr. Oz that it literally has the same effect as anti-depressants; 5-HTP works to produce more serotonin in your brain, which is the feel-good chemical that regulates mood, and in turn appetite and overall motivation to take on your days. Anti-depressants work to produce the same effect chemically, and in my personal case, just caused a slew of other side effects. This is a no-brainer for me; I'm all about curing depression through medicine and outside factors; I avidly take St. John's Wort as well as Niacin at night. I watch documentaries on hollistic health and I read about the topic often; it's something you have to take upon yourself, mostly, because media and the drug companies definitely don't support these studies. body: Creates as many side effects as a prescription SSRI. After being on Paxil for more than 10 years, I (with the help of my Dr.) decided to ween off. For fear of relapsing (severe anxiety with mild depression), and after some research, I decided to try 5HTP. For the first weak, I felt odd, not bad, just a bit off. During week 2, I was feeling good and thought I found a new miracle supplement. Week 3, I started to feel lightheaded, jittery, trouble focusing, numbness in various parts of my body, tired and had orange urine (usual clear, I drink plenty of water). Symptoms continued into week 4. After much more research and talks with my Dr. , I found out 5HTP effects cortisol levels. It was causing my blood sugar to be out of control. I stopped taking it, and now take a saffron supplement, and feel so much better. I know I'm not a Dr. and 5HtP with effect each person differently, but I would not recommend this to anyone. Healthy diet, daily cardio workout, and TaiChi was what initially gave me the strength to get of Paxil. I recommend that.

body: I gave this to my 13 year old son who has severe anxiety, mostly social anxiety.  After 2 days it made his anxiety incredibly worse!  He missed a day and a half of school because it made his anxiety so severe.  Because of this, I discovered the research done in Sweden that showed that people with specifically social anxiety actually have too much serotonin, not too little like previously believed.  This supplement raises serotonin levels which made his anxiety worse. (He had the same effect from Prozac- which confirms the theory for me-  too much serotonin!).  The only supplement that seems to help him is inositol (I buy the Best Naturals brand of powder and give him 2 tsp./day), it has a calming effect without making him tired.

body: I have (or used to have) my depressing days before this. I've had it for weeks now. And I am so relieved that it does what it says. No more depressing thoughts or feelings. Every once in a while I will get moody but they are very rare now. It came fast to me since I do have AmazonPrime. No this isn't sponsored, or given to me for free in exchange for a review. I bought this with my own money in hope to feel like a normal happy being. You know how you go through countless of reviews on hopes that they are true and you finally found a good product for whatever you want it to work for? Well this is it. I want you guys to know that my review is genuine it really is. There is no ulterior motive whatsoever. I will be buying again it just works so good for me especially with that price. I also recommend working out in the mornings for a even more healthy satisfactional happy day. It has been proven scientifically that working out makes you happy 😊 and yes yoga and Pilates is in that. Also have green tea it helps me relax and feel soothed. Ok so this product arrived in perfect conditions. Very well sealed in its box. Also the bottle was well sealed stuffed with cotton on the inside and the lid was in its place so you don't have to worry about tampering. The instructions to taking this product is one pill per day at nighttime before you go to bed after having had dinner or something to eat. You swallow the pill with water drink 6 to 8 ounces of water. That's it nothing complicated. And one pill is enough for me because it does work. My appetite still feels the same I mean these kind of anti depressant pills have a bad reputation for making someone gain weight but I'm not exactly stuffing my face in 5 cinnamon rolls. body: I've been using this product for over 3 months now, and it has seemed to make a huge difference in my overall mood. The only thing I haven't been happy about is that it seems to be causing my face to break out. I can't know for sure, but ever since I started taking it, I've been breaking out, whereas I rarely did before, and nothing else in my life, diet, stress, etc., has really changed. I have a much harder time getting the breakouts to clear up, and I seem to have a lot more scarring afterwards. It's a little discouraging, but taking it is worth the improvement in how I feel. I still get irritated over things, but I just don't feel as annoyed or bothered by things as I used to, or for nearly as long. I plan to stay off of it during the summer, since I always feel better in the summer due to the increase in sunshine. To me, this is worth using. My only fear is that I wonder if one could build up an "immunity" to this supplement, or become reliant on it.

body: I began taking this a month ago and just purchased my second bottle. I have Post Finasteride Syndrome (PFS), which includes ongoing side effects from the medication Propecia (even after stopping). This condition has impacted my life: cognitively, metabolism, sexually, digestion-wise, etc. After taking this product I do feel better than before: calmer and more at-ease. Post Finasteride Syndrome leaves you in a state of constant physical anxiety and with cognitive impairment (brain fog). This has helped my consistent anxiety and made me feel more normal again, like I used to feel. Also, I think it is helping with my sleep and energy. I am generally feeling more balanced and hope this lasts. Thank you for this product..... I hope any other men with Post Finasteride Syndrome read this review and buy this because it may really help.

body: While trying to come off Cymbalta (horrible drug!!) and dealing with painful withdrawal, I read 5-htp helps. I started taking 200mg and it helped some with the brain shocks of Cymbalta withdrawal. I increased my dose to 400mg 1x daily and saw more improvement in withdrawal symptoms. I have been off Cymbalta for over a year now. I have been taking 400mg - 800mg of 5-htp every morning. I have no issues with this supplement and I am doing much better with anxiety, depression, tension headaches, fibromyalgia, and generally feel more relaxed and calm. I only wish this brand offered higher doses or higher pill count so I need less bottles. Overall very happy with the product

body: I've been using this product for over 3 months now, and it has seemed to make a huge difference in my overall mood. The only thing I haven't been happy about is that it seems to be causing my face to break out. I can't know for sure, but ever since I started taking it, I've been breaking out, whereas I rarely did before, and nothing else in my life, diet, stress, etc., has really changed. I have a much harder time getting the breakouts to clear up, and I seem to have a lot more scarring afterwards. It's a little discouraging, but taking it is worth the improvement in how I feel. I still get irritated over things, but I just don't feel as annoyed or bothered by things as I used to, or for nearly as long. I plan to stay off of it during the summer, since I always feel better in the summer due to the increase in sunshine. To me, this is worth using. My only fear is that I wonder if one could build up an "immunity" to this supplement, or become reliant on it.

It took it according to instructions - full stomach and first thing in the morning.  I immediately got a head ache that wouldn't go away, felt nauseated, and just felt "icky" all over.  I Didn't sleep well that night. Thought I'd try it again thinking my body was just getting used to it.  I had the same experience the next day and on the third day. . .so I stopped taking it.  Everyone's body is different and my body just didn't like 5-HTP!

body: Have been taking this for over one month , I'm noticing a definite improvement in my mood , it seems the negative thoughts don't take root in my head any more like they used to - before taking the 5 htp some ugly thought , or some silly comment made from someone would set up in my head and would not leave . I knew this was not how I wanted to be but could not stop feeling this way, I knew living like this was affecting my life and the ones I loved . I have been on antidepressants before and have stopped because of some side effect that would manifest sooner or later .  I hated the idea of being on them - never had any real relief anyways . I also would look up self help articles on the web , books , anything I thought would help with this problem I've been living with for most of my life . Then I came across information on the internet about 5 htp , decided to give it a shot - it's one of the best things I've ever done for myself , and I hope others suffering in the same way find the same relief I have had with this product . The best advice I can give is get on the internet and do your own research on symptoms of low serotonin levels . Read other people's experience using 5 htp , start with the lowest dosage and go from there . I figured out that for me it was best to take it late in the evening , right after supper or even a couple hours after supper was o.k. Mornings was not a good time because I felt it kind of made me feel edgy . The good results really started kicking in about three weeks taking this product , I am amazed at the peace of mind I have now , it's so good to go about my day and not have some horrible negative thought take over my mind completely. I also feel this has had other beneficial benefits to my general well being and health but I want wait a little longer to see if the improvement is consistent in those areas. I will try to post future updates on my experience using 5htp.

body: tried this product as a last resort for mood stabilizer & binge eating. i read all customer reviews before making this choice & did some  on line research about it as well. since my husband passed away, i have been having problems with the previously mentioned problems as well as panic attacks & a horrible sense of doom. i realize this is part of the grieving process for many but it has been almost 2 years & was hoping these problems would be winding down. i have never suffered with emotional issues so this is particularly difficult to comprehend. dr's answer is antidepressant &/or some kind of narcotic which seems like a band aid rather than a solution. so with all this in mind, i tried this product, taking one when i awaken. am not fully into a week yet & am seeing positive results so i am very hopeful. have noticed i am not on the verge of tears all the time & my binge eating is more manageable though not quite eliminated. i am sleeping better & not waking up with a full blown panic attack. just to not feel like crying all the time is reason enough to continue. still i am reserving 5 stars to see if i get a stronger result with each day i continue  use. there is always room for improvement. i will amend my rating if need be with an update if necessary.
title: better than expected

body: I've had pretty bad anxiety my whole life, and it got so sever that I went on Zoloft about a year ago. But the side effects - especially the weight gain and high cholesterol, which I never had an issue with before the medicine - made me decide to go off of it. After I fully tapered off of the Zoloft, my anxiety was even worse then before. Then I saw an integrative healthy doctor who recommended naturewise 5HTP. I didn't have very high expectations at first, but I am now a believer. I take one capsule each evening, along with some other helpful supplements like magnesium, vitamin D, and an herbal supplement called Tranquility. I am now virtually anxiety free. But unlike the Zoloft, I'm not emotionally numb. I just feel balanced and calm. I never thought that an over-the-counter supplement would be able to benefit me so dramatically.  I feel better than I've ever felt.  I wish I had found this product years ago.
title: I've had pretty bad anxiety my whole life

body: I noticed a difference in how I felt within a week of taking this product. I am just amazed.  I wake up feeling energized and ready to face my day.  I ususally really struggle getting going everyday, and basically have to talk myself into facing the day.  I feel more rested, but I have really noticed an improvement in my feeling of well-being.  My biggest crash comes around my monthly cycle, I always struggle.  I happened to start taking this around the same time, and let me tell you, 100% improvement in my mental well-being.  I just can't recommend this enough, I will definitely continue to take this!
title: Amazing

body: This stuff is amazing. I'm a 26 y/o female. I take a serving every three days or so with a meal. Before I had this there would be days I would come home from work and not want to move. For a solid three days after taking this my motivation will be significantly higher and my patience with my coworkers? Wow! I really don't know how I've gone so long without this. body: Although I do not have experience with other brands of 5-HTP, this has helped me tremendously! I have tried many other vitamins and supplements but this is the ONLY thing I have tried that has almost no side effects (the occasional headache or nausea if I forget to eat with it) and actually WORKS. I am beyond happy and blessed to have found something that works so I do not have to take prescription meds. I feel so happy and motivated when I take it, but most of all I feel like myself. There is no dopey, medicated feeling. Another plus is that if I for get to take it for a day or two, I still feel the benefits before I have to make sure I take another.  I do notice some appetite suppression but not enough to make a big difference (like I would like lol).

I shopped around and no one had any 5-HTP that was organic. I wanted a chemical-free, organic, gluten-free product because I am very careful what I consume. I was so glad to finally locate what I searching for on Amazon at a wonderfully low price. Both my daughter and I use the product to suppress appetite, and manage weight.

body: I bought these as a sleep aid to replace the Trazodone that I had been taking. The trazodone would leave me groggy sometimes, and I would rather take an herbal supplement than a medication, but that's just me. This seemed to do just as well as the trazodone for sleep. Sometimes my mind keeps going when my body is ready for sleep. This helps to calm me and make me relaxed enough to fall asleep. I also noticed that I just felt a little less worried about things in general. After I ran out, I bought some Valerian root to try it out and see if I could replace 5htp with Valerian root. It doesn't seem to help at all with sleep, and I might end up throwing it out because Valerian actually smells like dog poop. I am going to buy another bottle now, and also plan on pursuing a free bottle from NatureWise for writing this review.
title: Great for sleep and anxiety

body: I got on a vitamin kick and while doing some research, I heard that 5-HTP was a good vitamin to take.  The box says that it is used to help aid sleep, appetite suppressant and help your mood.  Of all the three things it boasts, there is one that I absolutely felt the effects of and that was the sleep aid.  I really didn't know any better and started taking these in the morning with my other pills and on the first day, I noticed that I felt very lethargic throughout the day.  After speaking with a rep from the company I purchased from, she said that it is recommended to take them about an hour to 30 minutes before bedtime for best results.  I ended up changing to taking them at night and I was getting better sleep, but really had not noticed much difference in my appetite control or mood.

body: I have three kids. My house is embarrassing, I can't remember that dinner is a thing I need to do every day, I find pretending with my kids to be torturous, I get grouchy and moody and take offense at my husband's good natured teasing. I eat because my house is messy and I don't want to clean it.  After two days this turned me into one of those cheerful moms who bakes fresh bread in the morning, packs lunches in five minutes (because of the conscientious shopping the day before), remembers to water the strawberries, starts dinner at noon in the slow cooker. I did all my dishes, like ALL of them, even that old wok on my floor I haven't noticed in six months. I assembled a storage bench and organized the kids books into it. I swept and mopped my floors. After picking up ungodly amounts of crap. I cleared off my deck and made it a place where my kids actually want to hang out. I found myself laughing hysterically with my husband at midnight as I tried to sneak into the top bunk to check on an owie that my kid is self conscious about. I made more bread dough so I could bake it in the morning. I hauled all the s*** out of my closet and gave half of it away and reorganized it. I did loads and loads of laundry-- cheerfully!  Singing! Being goofy with my kids! I sat down and did a whole real art project with them, which we sent to grandma along with letters! By day three I was a little manic so I took a day off. Two on and one off seems to work. I probably need a slightly lower dose but love it just the same.
title: made me super-me

body: I like to do extensive research on any supplements before taking them. The supplement market is full of products that offer no real benefit to the consumer other than lining the pockets of the manufacturer. It is always "buyer beware" and In the US, the market for supplements is huge and the regulatory oversight is practically non-existent. After reading about the benefits of 5-HTP (antidepressant, appetite suppressant, great sleep aid.) I decided to try it. It works to great effect which is also the reason I would recommend caution. When they say to be careful if you have an issue with depression or take antidepressants or have bipolar disorder, heed the advice. 5-HTP can seriously jack up your serotonin levels and throw you into mania or acute depression. Take exactly as it says on the bottle. If you take the recommended dose and take it at night, it is a great way to help you sleep and works better than any antidepressant I have ever taken. If you have a tendency (as I do) to think that if one is good, then four must be better, then be prepared to ride an emotional roller coaster that will last for as long as it takes for your serotonin levels to return to a semblance of normal. I mean it, this stuff is powerful. I know that people with bipolar disorder have a forever fascination with tweaking the chemicals in their brain, but this isn't one you want to play around with and the latitude of dosing is narrow.
title: This is the real deal. Be very careful when taking it, it can seriously alter your mood.

body: I had been taking an anti depressant (celexa) for about a year to help with some social anxiety. After coming across some information about the impact SSRIs can have when taken long term I decided I wanted to go off it. I weaned off slowly and did okay for awhile but the anxiety started creeping back. I didn't want to go back on the prescription so I did some research and found 5htp. This has definitely helped with my anxiety. It isn't the same as my previous medication but it gives me the extra boost I need to get through the day. I take one in the morning and one at night, I orignally thought that I was just having a placebo effect but recently I forgot to take it for a few days and really noticed a difference.
title: Helped replace my SSRI

body: I have been taking 5 htp on and off for 10 years now.  It's helped me with my mood balance and depression throughout the years and it is a instant gratification pill of sorts, unlike some of its more dedicated counterparts like St. Johns Wort.  5-htp is a serotonin replacement, because for some of us, we use more serotonin and can't produce it fast enough.  The way I like to describe it to people is this:  Think of serotonin as this well or reservoir in your brain.  The water goes up and down.  When the water goes down, the life rollercoaster goes down, then you refill it and everything is great, but then you burn it again.  By taking 5-htp, you are keeping it filled, so you have less down cycles and can have a smooth flat ride without any dips or surprises.
title: A life changing supplement, but know what you are taking and always research.

I wasn't to keen on switching to a prescription anti-depressant because my family has a history of reacting poorly to them. So, I did a lot of research on natural supplements and came up with 5-htp. I've been taking it for 2 days now and I am blown away. I have ZERO appetite, a constant feeling of zen, and I no longer feel like I am about to internally combust! body: I've needed to take prescription antidepressants, my entire adult life.  From the time I was 15, until now (age 26), my life has been a living Hell without the pills normally prescribed by a doctor.  When I lost health insurance coverage on my last birthday (became too old to be on my parents' plan), I began looking into alternatives to the SSRI's that I'd been taking for a decade.  I decided to try out 5-HTP, and I haven't looked back since.  Not only does this supplement aid against my depression, it does so better than any of the pills my doctors ever prescribed for me, and it costs me less than $5/month, which is cheaper than the $10 co-pay I was shelling out before.  I love this stuff, and I suggest it to anyone I meet with depression problems.
title: Who needs doctors?

body: I have always suffered from mild mood disorder, general anxiety, stress-induced panic attacks, mixed with ups and downs. My chiropractor mentioned L-5-HTP, so I gave it a try. I find that my body builds a tolerance after awhile, and I will stop and restart again with no side effects in the meantime. After taking L-5-HTP, I feel happy, calm, and my life is in perspective. Make sure you purchase the L-5-HTP, not just cheap HTP. The L-tryptophan is the active ingredient on a molecular level, with vitamin C to help your body absorb the supplement.

body: I bought this bottle of chewable 5-HTP and normally take a tablet in the morning and evening in conjunction with Ashwagandha. I can't swallow pills-- that's the only reason I bought the chewable version. Do yourself a favor, if you can swallow pills with ease, get a tablet or veg capsule. The taste is absolutely awful. Additionally, due to my having read many comments about 5-HTP, I've always been very careful to take it with food and never on an empty stomach. I once did, however, absentmindedly take one of these in the morning before I had breakfast, and good god was I reeling in pain. It was awful. Only after drinking a glass of water did I mercifully throw up and feel better. In short, I don't know if it was the 5-HTP that made me feel so awful or the formulation of the tablets, but I will not be buying this product again. I believe in 5-HTP and know it helps, but I'm going to go with another brand that doesn't make me gag.

body: I took 1 100mg capsule the first night and I had what was probably the best night's sleep in my entire life. I've had insomnia since I was 12 and I haven't gotten a good night's sleep since (I am 21 years old). But the morning after I took it for the first time I was feeling amazing! I had no appetite and barely ate anything all day but I had so much energy and I felt so happy. It was as if my normally very loud inner monologue telling me that I'm a terrible person was finally quiet. I felt at peace for the first time. This "high" lasted a few days and then it sort of mellowed out. I started taking 1 every 12 hours instead of every 24 hours and it was working decently well. It's been 2 months since I started taking it and I think it's stopped working completely. My mood has been a nightmare and I wake up every morning  feeling completely exhausted as if I didn't sleep at all. I'm exhausted all day long. It also seems to have caused me to gain weight? I was surprised because for about a month I barely ate anything but I think the lack of food killed my metabolism and made me gain weight. I am going to stop taking it for a while and see how I feel.
title: Stopped working after 2 months

I'm not sure if its the better quality of sleep that is helping improve my mood or the better mood increasing my sleep...but either way it seems to be helping. I take 2 of these after I get home from work (around 6:30pm (200mg total) and they seem to take the edge off. This is an all-natural complex to help calm anxiety, ease restlessness, and drift you into a deep, restful, all-night sleep. You'll wake up feeling refreshed and ready to face the day without the groggy feeling you get from most sleep aids. Once I take these pills an hour in I feel a lot more "chill" and not as bothered by the days work. I even fall asleep quickly and get the better nights of sleep plus I feel refreshed in the morning...I have to say I'm impressed. I will be adding these to my daily intake of supplements.

body: I have always suffered from mild mood disorder, general anxiety, stress-induced panic attacks, mixed with ups and downs. My chiropractor mentioned L-5-HTP, so I gave it a try. Within 48 hours, I was feeling a night & day difference. Since I discovered this supplement, I take it in a cycle of a few months on and then a month off. I find that my body builds a tolerance after awhile, and I will stop and restart again with no side effects in the meantime. After taking L-5-HTP, I feel happy, calm, and my life is in perspective. Make sure you purchase the L-5-HTP, not just cheap HTP. The L-tryptophan is the active ingredient on a molecular level, with vitamin C to help your body absorb the supplement.

Needless to say, as soon as I stopped taking the 5-HTP I was suddenly better.  I tried taking it again just to be sure, and yes, it was definitely the 5-HTP making me sick. body: I started taking 5htp to address mild symptoms of depression and carb cravings.  Before I continue, I have to stress that my symptoms were mild.  I didn't have severe depressive symptoms such as sleeping all day, suicidal urges, etcetera.  I did a little reading, which suggested that low serotonin levels, a neurotransmitter that is often involved in mood imbalances, can make us crave carbohydrates.  After reading about the carb cravings and experiencing significant sadness for a prolonged period of time, I thought I should give it a shot.

body: Don't get me wrong, I'm not all happy and bubbly nor am I super emo and depressed. My life is filled with ups and downs like everyone else's. For me, 5-HTP simply puts me in an emotional place that I can accept the bad days instead of focusing on how terrible life is. There are not any noticeable side effects. Meaning, this is not like an N.o. Pump or Monster Energy drink that you feel working. 5-HTP is subtle, if you don't already know yourself you probably won't even notice it working!

body: I must say I didn't buy this b/c I have anxiety or to sleep better; I bought this to curb my appetite. I'm a case of nature vs. nurture, and nurture usually wins. I eat when I'm not hungry (presumably to get a chemical fix), and I stay awake even when my body is aching to go to sleep. Did this magically fix me? No. I have noticed that I remember my dreams more often, and that some of them are pretty vivid--though not lucid--so it must be doing something to me.
title: More vivid dreams

body: I used to go thru bouts of mild insomnia -- 3 to 4 days of not being able to fall asleep until an hour before the alarm went off. I hate the weirdo side effects and morning fog and sluggishness from taking over the counter or prescription sleep aids. So I started taking melatonin but after a few nights of 3mg my dreams would become a little too cranked up vivid. I also read that it could have an averse effect on the liver so I stopped taking it. After awhile I went thru another bout of insomnia and decided to try 5htp.
title: I hate the weirdo side effects and morning fog and sluggishness ...

body: I have been using 5HTP for some time now.  I was a St Johns Wort user for many years, but when I was put on a drug to lower my Cholesterol, I found out that St Johns had a negative effect with this type of drug, so I had to find an alternative,  I did my research and found 5HTP.  I was skeptical about getting the same effect as St Johns.  Well, I found that i had the same and even better results with this product. It helps with my mild depression and makes me feel good all day and even helps with sleep.  And best of all, does not interfere with my prescription meds.  this will always be a par of my daily supplement routine.  If you have mild depression, anxiety or trouble sleeping, give it a try.
title: Works for me.

body: I read about 5-HTP when searching for an alternative to calling the doctor for a prescription.  I've had a lot going on the last few years that has left me over emotional and a bit listless.  After a week or two of taking this supplement I happily noticed that I no longer teared up over every little minor thing, I've also noticed that when I forget to take it for a few days the over sensitivity would start coming back.  I recently also started taking a vitamin D3 supplement which has made an added positive difference
title: This works!

body: I have found this to be a good brand.  I tried 5-HTP to "take the edge off" when I was stressed and it worked.  I then noticed that I was getting less migraines and night time neck aches so I researched my migraine med (Zomig) and found that the active ingredient was 5-HTP.  I then increased my nighttime intake with great results.  Of course, everyone is different and your migraines may have a different cause, but this worked for me.  Do your homework and be careful not to take too much.  Also, if you are taking L-tryptophan make sure you include the converted 5-htp to your daily intake total.
title: I tried 5-HTP to "take the edge off"

body: So far so good.  I have only been taking this for a week, I do take 2 caps a day one when I wake and one a couple hours before bed.  My overall mood is lighter and my sleep is heavier.  I wake up feeling refreshed unlike sleeping meds and my anxiety is less noticeable.  Today I made it through walmart with no issues;)  May be five stars but still too early to tell.  No negative side effects, pill is small so easy to swallow, and overall I enjoy the fact it does what it says it's supposed to do!
title: Refreshing

body: I have been on 5HTP for years and years, actually on the recommendation of my OB!  She helped me move over from Celexa which I hated and was expensive on my insurance.  I don't know about the weight loss assistance, I gained weight on Celexa, and the 5HTP definitely doesn't do that, but the generally happier outlook on life really helps.  I worked with my nutritionist who gave me guidelines to start at 50mg, and I have found my best at 200mg daily.
title: Great product!

body: I suffer ptsd, depression, ocd, and fibromyalgia. I've taken this for a week and I notice a difference. I feel as though I need to take it a month and reevaluate,  but just three days in and my panic subsided and I have more energy and sleep better at night. I like that it's time released. My dr wants me to take 2 a day but I'm starring with 1 just to get used to it. No side effects that I'm noticing.
title: Good stuff

body: Gave me sinus headaches in the first two weeks. But I started taking it every other night and the headaches have gone away. I can tell my mood is slightly better already after about 3 weeks of taking it and actually was after the first week. I have no side effects now in my 3rd week.

body: I have used most other brands of this supplement, and this is by far the best dollar for dollar deal out there. It does seem as if my sleep has improved even since only switching brands, with this product having 4 times the quantity for the same price. Love the logo too!

body: This stuff really works.  I originally bought this with the hopes that it would help me sleep better, which it has.  I have been sleeping more soundly since the first night.  I also love how I feel a bit more giggly and less grouchy.  I can tell it has definitely boosted my serotonin levels.  I used to be on a lot of different antidepressants and refuse to go back on them.  This is definitely a much less expensive, works the first time you take it, and doesn't have any crazy side effects like big pharma antidepressants do.  I will definitely purchase this again.  And yes, I am getting a coupon for writing this review, but that has no bearing on what I have stated about my experience with the product.  A+++

body: I had to go off my 'man made' medicine on Jan. 7th b/c the doctor I have been going to doesn't take my insurance any longer. I was on Lamictal and Cymbalta for my depression, anxiety and extreme mood swings. When I came off that combination, I had the worst veritgo. I felt like I was 'out of myself' looking in. It was awful. I have been through this before, coming off medication b/c of insurance issues in my life time. I didn't want to find another doctor...again. I am 47 and I just want to feel 'normal'. Sooo, I decided to take another approach. I researched different natural medicines and this is what I came across. Along with St. Johns' Wort. I started taking both Jan. 14th. It has only been 4 full days. But during the week I was off of the other, I feel better TODAY knowing I am taking a pro-active approach. I read all of the reviews possible here on Amazon along with additional research and if it's half as good as all have said, then I think I will feel great in another few days!! Good Luck to me and this journey, I hope it to be a fulfilled one! Thank you to all who do post reviews. They really do make a difference!!

body: I have been thanking God in Heaven for this amazing product! Every year by end of July my brain detects the decrease in light, I begin to crave carbs, and, as time goes on, start feeling DOWN. By end of Sept I am cranky, have to make myself get out of bed in the mornings, feel foggy-headed, unmotivated, and depressed until March. Usually gain 10 lbs in winter. Whoever named it SAD [Seasonal Affective Disorder] hit the nail on the head. I take St Johns Wort, Curcumin C3, and Rhodiola Rosea. While these have helped tremendously in the past, for some reason it wasn't enough this year. Saw doctor and got prescription for Wellbutrin; but, after three weeks it made my stomach hurt and my anxiety level was out the roof. So, I went to Internet to find something else natural. Spent an afternoon reading reviews of various products and came across the Natrol line. Started on the Natrol 5-HTP Time Release 200 mg about 4 weeks ago and have had excellent results. Wake up feeling rested, motivated,  energetic, and clear-headed with NO side effects. I take it in the evening with food. Started on low carb diet about the same time I started this product and am thrilled to report I am NOT craving bread and pasta as in the past. It is REALLY a miracle and answer to prayer for me! Haven't weighed but my clothes are beginning to feel a bit baggy. I reordered the twin-pack and loved the savings.
title: End of SAD for me!

body: Ok, so I will update this review over time, if something changes. So I started taking 5-HTP 25 days ago. I stared with 10 days at 100 mg, due to reviews that I had read about working up in dose versus starting right away at 200mg. Then I switched to the 200mg and am still taking it. My plan is to complete 16 more days (30 total at 200mg) and then decide to continue or not. When on the 100mg dosage, I didn't notice much change in mood, but DID notice an improvement in my sleep (full 7-8 hours uninterrupted!) and bowel regularity - I know, may seem strange but seriously, I did. However, when I switched to the 200mg, I experienced only 1-2 days of notable 'mood change', possibly related to accomodating to the higher dose? Or it could have been coincidental, related to other factors on those given days - hard to say. After that, pretty much back to what I was feeling on 100mg. Not a bad thing, still sleeping better & with the 'other' benefit as mentioned, so that's good. But as far as dramatic change or uptick in mood? Nothing notable for me. One note, is that I wasn't really in a super depressed or deep 'funk' to start with  (more like a slow wear down over the last 6 months), so maybe that is a factor to consider, in that the change maybe would not be as dramatic as others have experienced. But will keep you posted. Again, it still has some benefits, just not as 'life-changing' for me, as it seems to have been for others. But it could be simply the way my body metabolizes it.
title: Not bad...just not as dramatic as expected...so far.

body: I have been thanking God in Heaven for this amazing product! Every year by end of July my brain detects the decrease in light, I begin to crave carbs, and, as time goes on, start feeling DOWN. By end of Sept I am cranky, have to make myself get out of bed in the mornings, feel foggy-headed, unmotivated, and depressed until March. Usually gain 10 lbs in winter. Whoever named it SAD [Seasonal Affective Disorder] hit the nail on the head. I take St Johns Wort, Curcumin C3, and Rhodiola Rosea. While these have helped tremendously in the past, for some reason it wasn't enough this year. Saw doctor and got prescription for Wellbutrin; but, after three weeks it made my stomach hurt and my anxiety level was out the roof. So, I went to Internet to find something else natural. Spent an afternoon reading reviews of various products and came across the Natrol line. Started on the Natrol 5-HTP Time Release 200 mg about 4 weeks ago and have had excellent results. Wake up feeling rested, motivated,  energetic, and clear-headed with NO side effects. I take it in the evening with food. Started on low carb diet about the same time I started this product and am thrilled to report I am NOT craving bread and pasta as in the past. It is REALLY a miracle and answer to prayer for me! Haven't weighed but my clothes are beginning to feel a bit baggy. I reordered the twin-pack and loved the savings.
title: End of SAD for me!

body: Ok, so I will update this review over time, if something changes. So I started taking 5-HTP 25 days ago. I stared with 10 days at 100 mg, due to reviews that I had read about working up in dose versus starting right away at 200mg. Then I switched to the 200mg and am still taking it. My plan is to complete 16 more days (30 total at 200mg) and then decide to continue or not. When on the 100mg dosage, I didn't notice much change in mood, but DID notice an improvement in my sleep (full 7-8 hours uninterrupted!) and bowel regularity - I know, may seem strange but seriously, I did. However, when I switched to the 200mg, I experienced only 1-2 days of notable 'mood change', possibly related to accomodating to the higher dose? Or it could have been coincidental, related to other factors on those given days - hard to say. After that, pretty much back to what I was feeling on 100mg. Not a bad thing, still sleeping better & with the 'other' benefit as mentioned, so that's good. But as far as dramatic change or uptick in mood? Nothing notable for me. One note, is that I wasn't really in a super depressed or deep 'funk' to start with  (more like a slow wear down over the last 6 months), so maybe that is a factor to consider, in that the change maybe would not be as dramatic as others have experienced. But will keep you posted. Again, it still has some benefits, just not as 'life-changing' for me, as it seems to have been for others. But it could be simply the way my body metabolizes it.
title: Not bad...just not as dramatic as expected...so far.

body: I've been taking these for about 2 weeks now, and I really think they're working.  Please note: I'm not an expert on supplements or diet or health or anything.  I'm just an average guy who read about these, thought they sounded promising, and decided to try them.  I can only tell you my personal impressions.  I understand that they help in 3 main areas:  better sleep, less appetite and better mood. After a few days of taking them, I actually did start sleeping better.  I typically wake up a lot at night, but lately it's been reduced to almost never. When I do wake up, I'm able to go right back to sleep. I've felt more rested overall. So two thumbs up in that department. Regarding the benefit to your appetite, I've seen positive change here too.  I usually have two settings: full and starving. Full lasts until about 30 minutes after I eat, and then it's right back to starving. Although I still do get hungry as normal, the edge is gone. It's much more manageable and the need to eat feels much less urgent. I don't recall having that "starving" sensation at any point since I began taking these supplements.  And when I do eat, I've found I'm typically consuming only about 75-80% of what I usually do.  So I never feel as hungry as I did before and my portions are smaller. So that's a total win.  As for elevating your mood, I can’t speak as much to this. I’m typically pretty even keeled and upbeat- so wasn’t really looking to this supplement for help in this area. But all in all, my results have been more than positive, and I’m going to keep taking these every day.
title: They seem to be working!

I haven't lost fourty pounds or found a man with a job but I do feel like I have a better mood, I'm slower to anger and I'm not yelling at my kids half as much as before--- they fight with eachother A LOT and I'm a single mother so sometimes yelling is all I have to combat the kid wars. Will update if I start to feel blah again. But happy right now. And getting a lot done! Sleeping like a baby too. I feel well rested when I wake up and have even been able to drink less coffee--- I was drinking a pot a day. I did NOT receive this product at a free or discounted rate. I'm a full price paying costumer who just felt crappy and bought this product based on desperation and positive reviews.

body: I was very skeptical about ordering 5-HTP from Intranaturals because, I have tried several different 5-HTP  supplements made by various by  companies that did not work.  Each company making the the same statement that their 5-HTP  naturally boost serotonin level, enhances mood, helps control appetite, and improve sleep. But, after suffering for many years from chronic insomnia which, caused my Leptin levels to be out of control causing me to overate and gain s lot of weight. That made my existing health problems much worse. I have Lupus, severe Spinal Disc Degeneration , and spinal stenosis causing a lot of nerve damage.  That means I am in constant pain.  Prescription sleep medications and antidepressants did not help my insomnia.  Needless to say, all the above contributed to a low serotonin level and depression.  I have refused to take more prescription medications.  I am already on  too many as is. I started taking the 5-HTP twice a day as soon as I received it. I did not notice a difference until I have been taking it about 1 week. I began to sleep better, feel less hungry , and my general overall mood has improved. Getting more sleep also helped to decrease my pain level. I have felt better physically and emotionally better the past week or so then I have felt for the past 3 years.  I am thrilled to find a supplement that actually does what it is claims to do. I highly recommend this product to anyone having the same or similar problems that I've been enduring or anyone suffering from a similar problems.  While it may not work for everyone, I believe it can help the majority of people who need it. Since, IntraNatural  5-HTP is working so well for me, imagine what it can do for people who has mild insomnia, are overweight, and have mild depression. While I do take an  anti-depressant, the 5-HTP has really made the difference.
title: very pleased that this 5-HTP supplement  works as advertised !

I have taken 5HTP consistently over the last 8 years and I know when I've missed several doses (because my mood suffers.  I have mild-moderate depression). I am going to go back to a brand that has consistently worked for me in the past.  With this one, I feel like it's not working AT ALL.  I feel like I have been on nothing since I started taking it three weeks ago.  My mood/depression has gotten progressively worse over this time period without any "triggers". Cannot recommend.

body: I ordered 5-HTP as a sleep supplement and later became interested in it after reading The Mood Cure by Julia Ross.  5-HTP plays a crucial role in helping regulate mood and sleep.  As I understand it, our bodies convert 5-HTP into serotonin, then from serotonin into melatonin.  For those suffering from a lack of serotonin (which causes mood disorders) and/or melatonin (which causes sleep problems), this supplement could be life changing.  A CAUTION:  Those taking SSRI drugs (like Lexapro, Prozac, etc) should NOT take 5-HTP unless under a doctor's supervision, as too much serotonin can actually have the opposite effect intended, creating insomnia and worsening mood problems.
title: Could be life changing!

body: This product has made the difference in my depressive state. I feel great. I am an empty nester and have experienced a lot of changes in my life that have had a difficult time adjusting. I take two caps in the morning and one around 5pm everyday for a total of 300mg per day.
title: Works Well for Me, Honestly Saved My Sanity

body: If you have trouble sleeping sporadically or regularly, you've probably already tried multiple products.  I've experimented with prescriptions like ambien, but abandoned them after finding empty food containers I'd apparently emptied while sleep eating!  Scary. I've used tryptophan with some success and discovered magnesium tablets had a noticeable effect though I'd never known of it's efficacy before.  Melatonin is effective for resetting the sleep cycle timing, but it's not encouraged being used regularly. I saw 5-HTP mentioned in an article somewhere and decided to experiment with it.  The effect wasn't dramatic like prescription products, but that's a good thing.  It does seem to lend a calming relaxation that aids getting to sleep when taken 30 minutes before bed. But it does seem to induce more dreams and more vivid dreams, which in my layman's understanding would seem to indicate REM sleep.  So far I'm very happy with the results.  I don't wake up groggy or affected as with other options so feel it's safe, at least for me.  Each of our bodies chemistries of course react differently to things we ingest, but if you want to try something natural and gentle, I can recommend this product from my experience so far.
title: Seems to relax and encourage sleep. Also increased dreaming indicating REM sleep is encouraged.

After some research I found that 5HTP would have similar positive results as the St Johns, without the drug interaction.  I love how I feel and I sleep like a baby without a sleep aid.  I will continue to purchase it from IntraNaturals, as they took the time to write to me to see how I was doing.  That's customer service at it's best.  Thanks to them for making this fine product.  If you have mild depression or anxiety, or just need something to take away your stress and help with sleep, then this is the one for you.  It does take a week or so to kick in, but I wouldn't be without it.

body: Although I've only taken this supplement for two days, I can say that I have slept like a baby the past two nights.  Now, having said this, I have struggled with sleep problems for nearly four years.  I am so exhausted, I fall asleep as soon as my head hits the pillow; however, I cannot stay asleep.  I usually awaken any time between 1:00 am - 4:00 am, and I can't go back to sleep.  I could probably attribute this sleep loss to any variety of reasons: a touch of anxiety, peri-menopause, a magnesium deficiency, sleep apnea (I have been on a C-PAP machine for the past seven years) drop in melatonin levels with age...who knows.  The work week will probably be the true test as I am a school teacher and my mind starts racing the second I wake up.  Some reviewers have spoken to feeling less anxious and/or having less appetite, but I've not noticed these benefits in tthe wo days...maybe with further dosing.  I will update my review after a week or two.

body: I have suffered from migraines, typically brought on by lack of sleep, anxiety, and depression for many years. I bought this more for the sleep aid claims than anything, but have noticed that I'm typically in a better mood, have less "bad" days, and can actually be in a crowd without completely dissolving into a panic attack after taking one a day for about 3 months. I take 5-HTP in conjunction with 1mg of melatonin before bed and usually fall asleep within an hour rather than many hours later or not at all. Because of the better sleep, I've had less migraine attacks, which makes this a win in my book! I let IntraNaturals know that I loved it, so they sent me a second bottle for free. Even my husband has noticed a difference in my mood and overall well-being and for that, we're both thankful.

body: I had a bad adverse reaction of extreme muscle weakness after getting of my antidepressant and wanting a substitute and was advised to stop taking immediately. Please be warned before using 5-HTP of any brand (not against this brand in particular), claims that 5-HTP works for depression by itself is not accurate. Please read credible research (as I am a nurse) on using this supplement on it's own. It depletes your other neurotransmitters, such as norepinephrine and dopamine, can cause severe adverse effects and may lead to lasting damage to your balance of catecholamines. There is no credible research that backs up it's claims using it by itself for depression and it's highly complicated positive or negative effects on other disease states. There are many adverse interactions using it in combination with other drugs and supplements as well and is not meant for the lay person to understand it's highly variable effects. Please consult your health care provider before you take 5-HTP period.
title: Adverse effects of taking 5-HTP of any brand.

body: I was dealing with a really bad bout of depression after the end of summer. It was beginning to affect my school and job and I needed help. Getting in to see a professional isn't always easy and I was hesitant to be given prescription mood elevators besides. So while I waited to see a professional I looked for some supplements. Since this was given such high reviews I tried it out. The first day it came I took one and went to class. By the time it kicked it I wasn't dwelling on upsetting things, or if I did, they didn't cause that stomach dropping depression. The side of the bottle recommends you take one a day however, looking through the internet I found the max you can take is 300mg=3 pills. I would take 1 in the morning and one at night to help with sleep. After about three weeks I had to up it to two in the morning and one at night. I was also taking St. John's Wort. While these pills didn't stop me from thinking of the incidents that led to my depression, it did stop me from feeling depressed, worthless, and not wanting to participate in activities. Add that to working through the issues, I was able to wean myself off these after 4 months.
title: Excellent Supplement for a Bout of Depression!

body: It took about a week for the pills to kick off. I was pleased with their effect in the beginning - my mood improved and I felt happy and easy going, nom ore outbursts and dark thoughts. However, about 10 days after the start I started having very strong heart palpitations, all throughout the day. I got scared and thought it was from all the stress I experiences before the pills. I was ready to go to the doctor, and then I thought it could be the pills. I stopped them and got better. Then I tried one pill again and the palpitations were back an hour later in full strength. I stopped the pills for good and returned them. The manufacturer was nice enough to give me a refund! It took about 10 days for the palpitations to fully disappear.
title: BEWARE - HEART PALPITATIONS POSSIBLE

body: I L♥VE this stuff! I am a terrible sleeper. I don't have too hard a time falling asleep, but staying asleep is my problem. I've taken many things to try and get a restful night's sleep and nothing ever really helps. Melatonin rarely works, and same goes for Excedrin PM (or equivalent). Nyquil is probably the best at helping me sleep, but that's not exactly a habit I want to develop. Besides not working, all of the aforementioned  drugs always leave me groggy and tired for a large chunk of the day (including the melatonin). This stuff, on the other hand, is awesome!!! I take two pills at night before bed and I pretty much sleep all night! Granted I still toss and turn so I wake up a little from that. But I don't wake-up wake up like I normally would. I actually feel rested in the morning. Especially on my weekends when I can sleep in as long as I want. And the best thing is that it doesn't leave me feeling groggy or sluggish! If I take it on a work night (which is usually only 6-7 hours of sleep) I am tired in the morning. But not the "Nyquil hangover" kind of tired that I never snap out of no matter how much coffee I drink. It's more the kind of tired I imagine normal sleepers feel when they simply didn't get enough hours of sleep, but nothing a cup or two of coffee can't cure. Better sleep means a lot. That's the body's time to rest and heal itself. Better sleep means my skin complexion and acne are a little better. Better sleep means it's a little easier to make it through my 12-13 hour work days. Better sleep means I'm less cranky and don't have to drink as much coffee. While I can't attest to whether it really improves my mood due to this supplement or simply because I'm sleeping better, I would not rely on this product purely as a mood enhancer/anxiety reducer.  I also would not take this any time of day other than in the evening or before bed. That's what the directions call for anyway, but just as a warning. I will definitely be buying this product again!
title: I finally get a restful night's sleep!

body: Order this and already starting to get results...wow. Had my bank account hit with fraudulent charges and was able to keep my cool  better then I would have ever done so in the past. body: After years of being on every anti depressant out there and even being on xanax, 5 htp was a life saver. My major problem was anxiety as well as, clinching my jaw, biting my nails/lips, trouble sleeping and  anxiety attacks. 5 htp helped with all of my issues. I started taking 50 mg once a day then went up till i reached 300mg a day and that is my perfect dose. Since being on 5 htp, my mood changed for better and I sleep all through the night without clinching my jaw while asleep so now i wake up with no headaches and fully rested. I havent had an anxiety attack and i also dont bite my nails or lips anymore. 5 htp has changed my life for the better. I wouldnt go back to anti depressants for anything!
title: 5 htp, better then addictive anti depressants!

The "Other ingredients" section lists Rice Flour, which is very strange and sounds like a cutting agent.

body: I do not normally write reviews for a lot I purchase through amazon but this one I just felt I had to take a minute to write. I have been on xanax and Ativan for anxiety for the last 2 years going through a rough time and have suffered a huge amount of depression as well. For me it was literally one night after I took my first dose of 5-htp that I woke up feeling like I could take over the world! I felt amazing and I actually got over 6 hours of sleep which I haven't done in 2 years. I kept waiting the whole next day to feel a crash but it never came...it's been a week and I feel happy, calm and stable for the first time...in a long long time. I started taking a few melatonin gummies along with the 5-htp right before bed and the combo allows me to sleep a straight 6-7 hours and I feel like a whole new me...my mood is just amazingly better and uplifted. My neighbor couldn't believe how it was helping me so they tried some and woke up feeling really good. Over the last few days I have told everyone I know about this and those closest to me can't believe how it's really helped me this past week... they are calling it my happy pill :) This stuff is truly a amazing and honestly I wasn't expecting the relief to be this good but it's like since I started these supplements I feel motivated and just plain good, which for me....is a huge deal.
title: Truly amazing -not expecting this kind of relief

body: While they don't help as much with falling asleep at night as I would have hoped, I will continue to purchase these because I have noticed an increase in energy and more positive mood. I forget to take them every night, but when I do remember I take two before bed. The next day, I feel cheerier and more energetic without any side effects. It's pretty amazing. I can't say if this would be good for someone with severe depression or anxiety, but to the average person like me who could just use the occasional boost in spirits, I highly recommend! I do find myself snacking less also. I'm not sure if this product really helps lower my appetite or if it's more of a lessening of mindless "stress eating" but either way I'll take it!
title: Great mood booster!

body: These shipped very fast and were packaged well. The product itself has been sort of mixed for us. They have helped my daughter improve her mood, stress-relief, and sleep, with zero negative side effects, so she likes them. For myself, my dreams became more vivid and intense, which was mildly unpleasant so I stopped taking them. I didn't experience any other side effects, and took them less than a week. My son doesn't like them, as he felt more aggressive on the days he took them. So, overall, I think this is a good product if it's what your body needs. Everyone's body is different though so you need to listen to your body and find what works for you. Definitely worth a try though, as my daughter can attest to.

body: Our Dr. recommended this product for my husband who has been suffering with extreme IBS-D for the 8 past months.  He's been on a pretty strict FODMAP diet to help with the diarhea and we've seen significant improvement but he continues to lose weight and have bowel cramps 3-4 times per week.  5-HTP has helped with some of his night wakings and taken him from 3 potty breaks per night to only 1.  It's not quite the immediate miracle happy pill we were hoping but it definitely has helped.  There's so many factors that could be effecting his IBS that it's hard to tell what's helping and what's hindingering (sleep, stress, diet, weather, etc.)  I'm tempted to try out this product to see if it will help some of my hypothyroid mood swings.  We'll report back if we notice any more changes worth reporting!
title: Prescribed for IBS-D sufferer

body: There are two types of 5-HTP: 5-hydroxytryptophan and L-5-hydroxytryptophan.  People think that they are the same, but they are not.  I suffer from a serotonin deficiency due to chronic pain and can thus tell the difference between the two types of 5-HTP when I take them.  The L-5 variation creates an empty-like feeling in my brain, and I felt this sensation when I took BRI's 5-HTP.  Reputable manufacturers say which 5-HTP variation is in their formula, but BRI must not be reputable because they don't say which variation they use.

body: There are two types of 5-HTP: 5-hydroxytryptophan and L-5-hydroxytryptophan.  People think that they are the same, but they are not.  I suffer from a serotonin deficiency due to chronic pain and can thus tell the difference between the two types of 5-HTP when I take them.  The L-5 variation creates an empty-like feeling in my brain, and I felt this sensation when I took BRI's 5-HTP.  Reputable manufacturers say which 5-HTP variation is in their formula, but BRI must not be reputable because they don't say which variation they use.
